Recipe.Author: Nicola Deluigi
Recipe.Name: Deep rinse v1
Recipe.Notes:
This recipe aims at rinsing your system after a brew.
As a general rule, I do a deep cleaning using the picobrew "New Clean Beta v6" every 3-4 batches, otherwise I rinse my system with the present recipe, which tends to better extract the left wort from the internals compared to the default rinse cycle that comes with the machine.

Setup:
-Make sure that all 3 mash screens are in place in the step filter. Do not insert the adjunct loaf/hop cages.
-Do not place any cleaning tab, it's just a rinse cycle and you don't want to let dish soap enter your system.
-Add 2.5 gallons of HOT tap water to the keg

At completion of cleaning cycle (zymatic will beep and display a message)
-Empty and rinse keg, step filter, screens, and in-line filter.
-Fill keg with 4 gallons of hot tap water
-Connect black fitting to 'OUT' post on keg
-Attach wand to grey fitting and run it into bucket or sink, OR attach grey fitting to 'IN' post on empty keg
-Continue, this will rinse your system. There should be no water left in the keg at the end of this step.

This recipe is a mod of Kevin "New Clean Beta v6" that only rinse your Z with hot water. Credits go to him.
Recipe.TastingNotes: A dark, intensely bitter, very light-bodied American Light Lager.

HumanBrewingSteps.LoadWaterAmendments: Load selected water amendments (generally dry ingredients go in with milled grain, liquid ingredients in start water, your recipe may vary)
HumanBrewingSteps.LoadMash: Mill grain and load into mash compartment
HumanBrewingSteps.LoadAdjuncts: Load hops and other boil/whirlpool additions into adjunct compartments:
HumanBrewingSteps.LoadFermentationAdditions: Load dry hops and fermentation additions into fermentation keg:
